article.description: Julius Hodge collected 26 points and 11 rebounds as the 24th-ranked Wolfpack remained unbeaten at home with an 86-71 victory over Wofford.
article.headline: Wolfpack continue their dominance vs. Terriers
article.linkText: Hodge's double-double lead N.C. State past Wofford
article.story:
RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- Julius Hodge had 26 points and 11 rebounds
and Clifford Crawford added a career-high 22 points as North
Carolina State (No. 24 ESPN/USA Today) overcame a poor-shooting first half to beat Wofford 86-71 on Sunday.

	   The Wolfpack (7-1) beat the Terriers for the eighth time in nine
meetings and improved to 34-3 against non-conference opponents at
the RBC Center under coach Herb Sendek. Wofford (4-5) hasn't beaten
N.C. State since the 1934-35 season.

	   The Wolfpack, who beat the Terriers 80-42 last year, shot 39
percent in the first half, including 2-for-12 from 3-point range.
However, they held Wofford to 37 percent shooting and 11 turnovers
in taking a 38-24 halftime lead.

	   The Wolfpack opened the second half with a 14-2 run, hitting
their first three field goals and attacking the rim aggressively.
N.C. State got into the bonus by the first media timeout of the
half, then made 11 of 12 free throws in taking a 57-34 lead on a
layup from Scooter Sherrill with 15:24 to play.

	   Lee Nixon had 15 points for Wofford, which got no closer than
the final margin.

	   N.C. State came in forcing an average of 21 turnovers per game
and forced 18 Sunday while holding Wofford to 43 percent shooting.

	   The Wolfpack hadn't played since beating Fairleigh Dickinson
104-65 on Dec. 21, and struggled from the field early, hitting
eight of its first 22 shots. But they forced eight turnovers in the
first six minutes, taking a 17-8 lead on a 3-pointer by Levi
Watkins eight minutes in.
